SEARCH
Package au.csiro.pathling.search

Class SearchColumnBuilder

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.search.SearchColumnBuilder
public class SearchColumnBuilder extends Object
Builds SparkSQL Column expressions from FHIR Search queries or FHIRPath expressions.

This builder creates Column expressions that can be applied to Pathling-encoded FHIR resource datasets. Columns are created eagerly (SparkSQL Column expressions are built at creation time), allowing them to be created without requiring a SparkSession or actual data.

The builder supports creating filter columns from:

  • FHIR Search queries (fromSearch(org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Enumerations.ResourceType, au.csiro.pathling.search.FhirSearch), fromQueryString(org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Enumerations.ResourceType, java.lang.String))
  • FHIRPath expressions (fromExpression(org.hl7.fhir.r4.model.Enumerations.ResourceType, java.lang.String))

Usage example: 


 // Create builder with default registry
 SearchColumnBuilder builder = SearchColumnBuilder.withDefaultRegistry(fhirContext);

 // Create filter column from FHIR search query string
 Column genderFilter = builder.fromQueryString(ResourceType.PATIENT, "gender=male");

 // Create filter column from FHIRPath expression
 Column activeFilter = builder.fromExpression(ResourceType.PATIENT, "active = true");

 // Combine filters using standard SparkSQL operations
 Column combined = genderFilter.and(activeFilter);

 // Apply to dataset using standard SparkSQL
 Dataset<Row> result = dataSource.read("Patient").filter(combined);

  • Constructor Details

    • SearchColumnBuilder

      public SearchColumnBuilder()

  • Method Details

    • withDefaultRegistry

      @Nonnull public static SearchColumnBuilder withDefaultRegistry(@Nonnull FhirContext fhirContext)
      Creates a builder with the default bundled search parameter registry for FHIR R4.

      This method requires an R4 FhirContext and uses the bundled R4 search parameters from the HL7 FHIR specification.

      Parameters:
      fhirContext - the FHIR context (must be R4)
      Returns:
      a new builder with the default R4 registry
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the FhirContext is not R4

    • withRegistry

      @Nonnull public static SearchColumnBuilder withRegistry(@Nonnull FhirContext fhirContext, @Nonnull SearchParameterRegistry registry)
      Creates a builder with an explicit registry.
      Parameters:
      fhirContext - the FHIR context
      registry - the search parameter registry
      Returns:
      a new builder

    • fromSearch

      @Nonnull public Column fromSearch(@Nonnull Enumerations.ResourceType resourceType, @Nonnull FhirSearch search)
      Creates a filter Column from a FHIR search query.

      Multiple criteria in the search are combined with AND logic.

      Parameters:
      resourceType - the resource type to filter
      search - the FHIR search query
      Returns:
      a SparkSQL Column representing the search criteria
      Throws:
      UnknownSearchParameterException - if a search parameter is not found in the registry
      InvalidModifierException - if an unsupported modifier is used
      InvalidSearchParameterException - if the search parameter configuration is invalid

    • fromQueryString

      @Nonnull public Column fromQueryString(@Nonnull Enumerations.ResourceType resourceType, @Nonnull String queryString)
      Creates a filter Column from a FHIR search query string.

      The query string should be in standard URL query format without the leading '?'.

      Parameters:
      resourceType - the resource type to filter
      queryString - the query string (e.g., "gender=male&birthdate=ge1990")
      Returns:
      a SparkSQL Column representing the search criteria
      Throws:
      UnknownSearchParameterException - if a search parameter is not found in the registry
      InvalidModifierException - if an unsupported modifier is used
      InvalidSearchParameterException - if the search parameter configuration is invalid

    • fromExpression

      @Nonnull public Column fromExpression(@Nonnull Enumerations.ResourceType resourceType, @Nonnull String fhirPathExpression)
      Creates a filter Column from a FHIRPath boolean expression.

      The expression should evaluate to a boolean value. Resources where the expression evaluates to true will be included in the filtered result.

      Parameters:
      resourceType - the resource type to filter
      fhirPathExpression - the FHIRPath expression (must evaluate to boolean)
      Returns:
      a SparkSQL Column representing the expression
